chart_metadata.name: paperless-ngx
chart_metadata.description: Paperless-ngx is a document management system that transforms your physical documents into a searchable online archive so you can keep, well, less paper.

runAsContext.description: Paperless-ngx can runs as root user.
Postgres runs as a non-root user.
Redis runs as a non-root user and root group.

capabilities.name: CHOWN
capabilities.description: Paperless-ngx is able to chown files.

capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE
capabilities.description: Paperless-ngx is able to bypass permission checks.

capabilities.name: FOWNER
capabilities.description: Paperless-ngx is able bypass permission checks for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETGID
capabilities.description: Paperless-ngx is able to set group ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETUID
capabilities.description: Paperless-ngx is able to set user ID for it's sub-processes.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Paperless-ngx

attrs.label: Admin User
attrs.description:
The admin user for Paperless-ngx.</br>
It is only used for the initial installation.

attrs.label: Admin Password
attrs.description:
The admin password for Paperless-ngx.</br>
It is only used for the initial installation.

attrs.label: Admin Mail
attrs.description:
The admin mail for Paperless-ngx.</br>
It is only used for the initial installation.

attrs.label: Enable Trash
attrs.description:
Enable the trash feature for Paperless-ngx.</br>
When enabled, documents will be moved to the trash instead of being deleted.

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Paperless-ngx.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Paperless-ngx files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Paperless-ngx files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Web Port
attrs.description: The port for the Paperless-ngx Web UI.

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.</br>

attrs.label: Paperless-ngx Data Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Paperless-ngx Data.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Paperless-ngx Media Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Paperless-ngx Media.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Paperless-ngx Consumption Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Paperless-ngx Data for Consumption.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Paperless-ngx Trash Storage
attrs.description:
The path to store Paperless-ngx Trash.</br>
This is only used when the trash feature is enabled.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Paperless-ngx Postgres Data Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Paperless-ngx Postgres Data.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Paperless-ngx Postgres Backup Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Paperless-ngx Postgres Backup.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Additional Storage
attrs.description: Additional storage for Paperless-ngx.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to a persistent volume claim.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB Share (Mounts a persistent volume claim to a SMB share)

attrs.label: Mount Path
attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Server
attrs.description: The server for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Share
attrs.description: The share name for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Domain (Optional)
attrs.description: The domain for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Username
attrs.description: The username for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: The password for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Size (in Gi)
attrs.description: The size of the volume quota.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for Paperless-ngx.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for Paperless-ngx.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

1.1.3.app_readme:
Paperless-ngx

Paperless-ngx is a document management system that transforms your physical documents into a searchable online archive so you can keep, well, less paper.
1.1.3.detailed_readme:
Paperless-ngx

Paperless-ngx is a document management system that transforms your physical documents into a searchable online archive so you can keep, well, less paper.
